41 EAST 42ND STREET, NEW YORK, N.Y.

October 26, 1939
Mr. Frank E. Schooley
Station WILL
bniversity of Illinois
brbana, Illinois
Dear Mr. Schooley:
There is enclosed a confidential preliminary
copy of a report prepared for this Committee by Professor
K. S. Van Dyke and Mr. R. L. 3rown on "Sound Recording Equip¬
ment for Schools”. This report will probably be printed
by the Committee for distribution to school teachers and
administrators•
In order that the report might have the great¬
est possible usefulness, I should like to get your comments
on any changes which should be made in it before publication.
To be most useful, your comments should reach me not later
than Thursday, Novomber 10, 1939.
On the cover page of the enclosure, there is
a restriction on the use of the report which I am sure you
will observe.
Sincerely yours.
Enc.
IS: ow
Irvin Stewart,
